an9.92:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these five emotional shackles.
an9.92:4.3: Firstly, a mendicant isn’t free of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures. …
an9.92:4.4: These are the five emotional shackles.
an9.92:5.1: To give up these five emotional shackles you should develop the four bases of psychic power.
an9.92:5.3: It’s when a mendicant develops the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to enthusiasm, and active endeavor. They develop the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to energy, and active endeavor.
an9.92:5.4: They develop the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to higher mind, and active endeavor.
an9.92:5.5: They develop the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to inquiry, and active endeavor.
an9.92:5.6: To give up those five emotional shackles you should develop these four bases of psychic power.”
